thread.title: Northern Lights dazzle over Michigan; another viewing opportunity may be in store
thread.title_full: Northern Lights dazzle over Michigan; another viewing opportunity may be in store

author: , Petoskey News-Review
title: Northern Lights dazzle over Michigan; another viewing opportunity may be in store
text: Northern Lights dazzle over Michigan; another viewing opportunity may be in store PETOSKEY — Those looking to the sky across much of North America got a glimpse of the Northern Lights on Thursday night, and they might get another chance on Friday. The aurora borealis seemed to be more prominent on Thursday than it had been earlier in the week. In Petoskey, handfuls of people gathered at Sunset Park and along the waterfront to watch the cosmic show. More: [Northern lights in Michigan: They're more visible now, but also still somewhat rare](https://www.freep.com/story/news/local/michigan/2024/10/11/northern-lights-michigan-tonight-photos/75625212007/) More: [Solar storm unleashes stunning views of auroras across the US: See northern lights photos](https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2024/10/11/northern-lights-aurora-borealis-photos/75624526007/) According to USA Today, Americans as far south as Alabama had a chance to witness the Northern Lights on Thursday. The stellar display was amplified when a solar coronal mass ejection of plasma clouds and charged particles drove a geomagnetic storm toward Earth. The storm was so strong that it prompted the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration to issue a rare G4 geomagnetic storm watch for the second time this year. — Contact Jillian Fellows at jfellows@petoskeynews.com.
